Hi Community,

Anyone has thought on the template level how I can get these modules aligned here?Regardless of the text the rich text module in grey always looks smaller than the image next to it:<http://5631553.hs-sites.com/-temporary-slug-77348077-0610-434d-bd5d-3e680aeee715?hs_preview=sTkytTBL-10154230769>

It should look like this:

You can set the height of the text to be equal to the img. So, if you are using img that are 200px x 200px then set the text div height to 200px. What would be even better though is using flex and setting the divs to stretch

You can create a custom module and use a repeater to allow the customer to dynamically add/ remove rows. You can set the images as background images set to `cover` so that they fill the area regardless of the amount of text.

Not sure what channel to put this in, *Link field bug*: our Marketing just launched like 10 new page updates from Content Staging, however the “Link” field type for a module updated the links to the “archived-0" path, and did not retain the published pages path. Also in the dropdown list of the Link field type, it is showing the “archived-0” along with the replaced page, this has to be a bug, right?

This publish of the new pages happen yesterday, so it has been multiple hours, seems like these staged “archived-0” pages should not be showing up in the list, and the links should not be updating automatically but retaining the published URL webpage

I use a custom button. Where the user can choose between cta/link/custom url. The problem is that I use this across multiple modules (most modules have a CTA Button). Is there anyway to nest this button module into the rest so I don't have to write the same code and create the same fields over and over again?
I know you can call a module into a HTML template. Just want to know if the same is possible inside the module context.
